H0.text: The circulatory system communicates with cells in muscle tissue so that the muscles contract or relax, allowing the body to move.

H1.text: The nervous system communicates with cells in muscle tissue so that the muscles contract or relax, allowing the body to move.

H2.text: Respiratory system is the organ system that communicates with cells in muscle tissue so that the muscles contract or relax, allowing the body to move.

H3.text: Excretory system is the organ system that communicates with cells in muscle tissue so that the muscles contract or relax, allowing the body to move.

A4.text: The excitatory signals induce contraction of the muscle cells, which causes the joint angles in the arm to change, pulling the arm away.

A5.text: The function of the nervous system is to send signals from one cell to others, or from one part of the body to others.
